content.question: A researcher studied 30 people ages twenty to forty, 30 people ages forty-one to sixty, and 30 people ages sixty-one to eighty. The researcher set up two roomsâ€”one with a faint rose smell, and one with a faint lemon smell. Each participant was asked to enter each room and identify the smell in the room. What research method did the researcher use, and what outcome would be found?

choices.label: Cross-sectional. As people age, their sense of smell diminishes, especially in older age.

Cross-sectional. No conclusions can be made because cause and effect cannot be inferred.

content.answer: Cross-sectional. As people age, their sense of smell diminishes, especially in older age.
